### assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots() {#a5a0c9359d4e969f68a7c7643fc3fcb5c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool RISCVFrameLowering::assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42; TRI, std::vector&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> &gt; &amp; CSI, unsigned &amp; MinCSFrameIndex, unsigned &amp; MaxCSFrameIndex) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots - Allows target to override spill slot assignment logic.

If implemented, <a href="#a5a0c9359d4e969f68a7c7643fc3fcb5c">assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots()</a> should assign frame slots to all CSI entries and return true. If this method returns false, spill slots will be assigned using generic implementation. <a href="#a5a0c9359d4e969f68a7c7643fc3fcb5c">assignCalleeSavedSpillSlots()</a> may add, delete or rearrange elements of CSI.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-h/#l00047">47</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-h">RISCVFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-cpp/#l01785">1785</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-cpp">RISCVFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### canUseAsEpilogue() {#a4c55a328d2daf9b5e2f457c8880e21c4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool RISCVFrameLowering::canUseAsEpilogue (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> whether or not the given <code>MBB</code> can be used as a epilogue for the target.

The epilogue will be inserted before the first terminator of that block. This method is used by the shrink-wrapping pass to decide if <code>MBB</code> will be correctly handled by the target. As soon as the target enable shrink-wrapping without overriding this method, we assume that each basic block is a valid epilogue.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-h/#l00068">68</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-h">RISCVFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-cpp/#l02091">2091</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-cpp">RISCVFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### canUseAsPrologue() {#af6c7d3374923da4e91bd8cdfd0d7f599}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool RISCVFrameLowering::canUseAsPrologue (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> whether or not the given <code>MBB</code> can be used as a prologue for the target.

The prologue will be inserted first in this basic block. This method is used by the shrink-wrapping pass to decide if <code>MBB</code> will be correctly handled by the target. As soon as the target enable shrink-wrapping without overriding this method, we assume that each basic block is a valid prologue.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-h/#l00067">67</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-h">RISCVFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-cpp/#l02074">2074</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-cpp">RISCVFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### determineCalleeSaves() {#aa2e3cf793a3ed0af11da73a0bfbb5ad1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void RISCVFrameLowering::determineCalleeSaves (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; SavedRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method determines which of the registers reported by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#ad71b5bc0aa81f5dec06cbfecaf2f7183">TargetRegisterInfo::getCalleeSavedRegs()</a> should actually get saved.

The default implementation checks populates the <code>SavedRegs</code> bitset with all registers which are modified in the function, targets may override this function to save additional registers. This method also sets up the register scavenger ensuring there is a free register or a frameindex available. This method should not be called by any passes outside of PEI, because it may change state passed in by <code>MF</code> and <code>RS</code>. The preferred interface outside PEI is getCalleeSaves.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-h/#l00034">34</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-h">RISCVFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-cpp/#l01412">1412</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-cpp">RISCVFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr() {#aeac33945153d277b7244196a35084006}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineBasicBlock::iterator RISCVFrameLowering::eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method is called during prolog/epilog code insertion to eliminate call frame setup and destroy pseudo instructions (but only if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a> is using them).

It is responsible for eliminating these instructions, replacing them with concrete instructions. This method need only be implemented if using call frame setup/destroy pseudo instructions. Returns an iterator pointing to the instruction after the replaced one.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-h/#l00044">44</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-h">RISCVFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-cpp/#l01677">1677</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvframelowering-cpp">RISCVFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### emitEpilogue() {#aa587d71d9d14ad035e31b99fc0c90802}

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["virtual"]}>

### getFrameIndexReference() {#a9258a9f50df17d6b3c064af9bf06c2bf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StackOffset RISCVFrameLowering::getFrameIndexReference (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, int FI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &amp; FrameReg) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getFrameIndexReference - This method should return the base register and offset used to reference a frame index location.

Returns the displacement from the frame register to the stack frame of the specified index, along with the frame register used (in output arg FrameReg).

The offset is returned directly, and the base register is returned via FrameReg.

This is the default implementation which is overridden for some targets.

hasReservedCallFrame - Under normal circumstances, when a frame pointer is not required, we reserve argument space for call sites in the function immediately on entry to the current function.

### restoreCalleeSavedRegisters() {#a6658cff9efc100c5b2751bed442d5a9b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool RISCVFrameLowering::restoreCalleeSavedRegisters (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mutablearrayref">MutableArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/calleesavedinfo">CalleeSavedInfo</a> &gt; CSI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &#42; TRI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
restoreCalleeSavedRegisters - Issues instruction(s) to restore all callee saved registers and returns true if it isn&#39;t possible / profitable to do so by issuing a series of load instructions via loadRegToStackSlot().

If it returns true, and any of the registers in CSI is not restored, it sets the corresponding Restored flag in CSI to false. Returns false otherwise.
